publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4532 Jackie Baillie: Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond—That the Parliament welcomes Scotland’s first solar powered boat based in Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park; notes that it will be used as a floating classroom, providing passengers with a knowledge of the loch and its islands, crannogs, plants, animals, geology and history; acknowledges that the boat is practically silent, generates no emissions and can accommodate up to 12 passengers, including wheelchair users; considers, in light of the recent good weather, that a solar powered boat is an imaginative and environmentally friendly addition to the national park, and encourages all to visit Loch Lomond and enjoy its natural beauty.

S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) Trish Godman*, Colin Fox*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Robin Harper*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr David Davidson*, Patrick Harvie*, Eleanor Scott*, Nora Radcliffe*, Marlyn Glen*, Murray Tosh*, Mark Ballard*, Rob Gibson*, Paul Martin*, Maureen Macmillan*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) Chris Ballance*, Shiona Baird*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Bill Butler*, Sarah Boyack*, Cathie Craigie*, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) Dr Elaine Murray*, Helen Eadie*, Dave Petrie*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*

S2M-4532 Jackie Baillie: Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond—That the Parliament welcomes Scotland’s first solar powered boat based in Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park; notes that it will be used as a floating classroom, providing passengers with a knowledge of the loch and its islands, crannogs, plants, animals, geology and history; acknowledges that the boat is practically silent, generates no emissions and can accommodate up to 12 passengers, including wheelchair users; considers, in light of the recent good weather, that a solar powered boat is an imaginative and environmentally friendly addition to the national park, and encourages all to visit Loch Lomond and enjoy its natural beauty. Supported by: Trish Godman, Colin Fox, Richard Lochhead, Mr Mark Ruskell, Robin Harper, Bruce Crawford, Mr David Davidson, Patrick Harvie, Eleanor Scott, Nora Radcliffe, Marlyn Glen, Murray Tosh, Mark Ballard, Rob Gibson, Paul Martin, Maureen Macmillan, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Chris Ballance, Shiona Baird, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Bill Butler, Sarah Boyack, Cathie Craigie, Ms Maureen Watt, Dr Elaine Murray, Helen Eadie, Dave Petrie, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Frances Curran*
S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) John Swinburne*
S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-4532 Solar Powered Boat on Loch Lomond (lodged on 12 June 2006) Linda Fabiani*
